I\u2019ve got this really bad pain in my belly that\u2019s going down to my groin, and I feel dizzy and weak.", "DOCTOR: QUESTION: Can you tell me exactly when the abdominal pain first started and how it has changed since then?", "PATIENT: It started suddenly a little while ago, and it\u2019s pretty much stayed the same since then. It\u2019s still very sharp, and I still feel dizzy.", "DOCTOR: This question is crucial to differentiate between ongoing or worsening conditions like dissection or perforation versus stable or improving situations, guiding immediate management priorities. QUESTION: Have you noticed whether the pain has gotten worse, stayed the same, or gotten better since it started?", "PATIENT: It\u2019s about the same \u2014 still very sharp and I haven\u2019t noticed it getting better or worse.", "DOCTOR: QUESTION: Have you noticed any new symptoms or changes in how your pain feels lately, like it getting worse, sharper, or spreading to other areas?", "PATIENT: No, I don\u2019t think it\u2019s gotten worse or sharper. It\u2019s pretty much the same as when I first felt it.", "DOCTOR: QUESTION: Have you had any recent imaging tests, physical examinations, or visits to healthcare providers regarding this pain?", "PATIENT: No, I haven't had any imaging tests or visits to the doctor about this pain before I came here.", "DOCTOR: QUESTION: Have you experienced any recent trauma, strenuous activity, or changes in your blood pressure or medication use that could have affected your blood vessels?", "PATIENT: No, I don\u2019t think I\u2019ve had any injury or heavy activity recently.
